intro: Memecylon golaense, commonly known as the Gola memecylon, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
